"recorded", "timestamp": "2018-06-01T00:00:00.059Z"}, {"source": "EMEA", "name": "recorded", "timestamp": "2018-06-01T00:00:00.093Z"}], "data": {"body": " (重溫稿)\n    * 短率穩中透松\n    * 月底加繳稅高峰因素迭加，交投活絡\n    * 短票利率持穩，高位稍滑落\n    * 債券RP市場需求大，投信走錢\n\n     記者 高潔如\n    路透台北5月31日 - 台灣銀行間短率周四穩中透松。資調人士稱，今日因大型銀行供給\n票券商多數資金，因此雖是月底最末日，又有繳稅最末日的數個變數迭加，但整體市況松于\n上日，惟需求也不少，交投活絡。\n    \n    大型銀行交易員表示，今日雖有大銀行以大筆資金買票，不過市場仍有不少需求，要求\n拆入的電話頗為不少。惟市況今日明顯稍松，調入容易，市場交投偏熱絡。\n    \n    〞大行放錢了，小銀行可以做貨幣市場的操作，供應資金的銀行比昨天多。〞一位大型\n銀行交易員說。           \n    \n    他們認為，今年的營所稅金額約2,000億台幣左右，可能在本周四-五和下周一的資金移\n轉會最明顯；也由於各方認為5月底至6月中旬的稅款入庫金額將達到最高，市場拆借心態將\n都偏向保守一點。        \n    \n    　           \n 本地時間17:50                    今日報價                  上日收盤\n 台幣兌美元<TWD=TP>              29.980                     30.050    \n 台灣加權股價指數<.TWII        10,874.96                  10,821.17    \n >                                                   \n 隔夜銀行間拆款加權平均            0.190%                    0.191%\n 利率                                                \n <PIBC><TPITWDOND=>                                  \n   --隔夜拆款利率區間           0.180-0.260%               0.180-0.280%\n   --一周拆款利率區間           0.188-0.430%               0.190-0.430%\n   --兩周拆款利率區間           0.310-0.430%               0.220-0.430%\n        \n    \n    **短票利率持穩，高位稍滑落**\n    \n    短票部分，票券商表示，今日大型銀行進場供給資金令市況趨松，各票券雨露均霑，令\n資金情勢明顯好轉。\n    \n    他們認為，大型銀行的利率30天左右開出0.40%，長達兩個月(60天)利率則在0.41%，因\n此壓低了平均利率。\n \n    〞主要行庫也出來，也讓市場放心了，〞一位大型票券商交易員表示。\n               \n    今日30天短票賣斷的利率區間在0.40-0.41%，高位0.42%漸少；上日在0.40-0.42%。 \n \n    據集保公司資料，上日自保30天短票成交加權平均利率在0.417%，區間在0.40-0.47%，\n成交金額為126.88億台幣；前日自保30天短票成交加權平均利率在0.415%，區間在0.40-0.4\n2%，成交金額為38.83億台幣。\n \n    在60天短票方面，上日自保60天短票成交加權平均利率在0.415%，區間在0.40-0.42%，\n成交39.06億台幣；前日成交加權平均利率在0.407%，區間在0.36-0.42%，成交30.71億台幣\n。\n    \n    台灣央行周四發行338億台幣定存單，發行餘額增4億台幣。周五定存單到期則有993.2\n億。\n    \n    拆款中心資料<PIBC>顯示，周四銀行超額準備850億台幣，累計超額準備1兆3,788億台\n幣、加計前期1%的超額準備1兆4,987億台幣。   \n         \n     \n    **債券RP市場需求大**\n    \n    債券附買回(RP)市場方面，大型證券商交易員表示，普遍而言今日市況較先前偏緊，投\n信明顯走錢，銀行則因要跨月而不供給資金，壽險也保守。\n    \n    〞其實大家都有點缺，但也還好啦，我的缺口本來很大，不過不到10點半也就平了，〞\n一位大型證券商交易員說。\n        \n    他們認為，明日雖是提存期的最末日，但已是月初，投信倒可能受惠月初資金回流，因\n此市況反而可能趨多。 \n     \n    周四有大筆金額交割，包括Morgan Stanley Finance擬發行1.4億美元債券、QNB Finan\nce擬發行15億美元債券；周五DBS Bank擬發行1.1億美元債券、First Abu Dhabi Bank擬發\n行11億人民幣債券。\n    \n    今日證券商與金融機構承做利率區間稍高一些；公債利率主要成交在0.32-0.33%，上日\n在0.31-0.33%；公司債利率則偏向區間高位，區間大致仍在0.40%-0.42%。\n     \n    今日大型票券商與金融機構承作債券利率大致持穩上日；極短天期債券利率在0.23-0.2\n4%；公債RP利率主要在0.28-0.30%；公司債方面利率0.28-0.35%。(完)\n\n    <^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^\nmmt    https://reut.rs/2La9EvQ\n {"guid": "L3N1T24I0_18060126KJzqNGfMvHg/D2aGR6q2ag4p30BfWSaG2T0B", "timestamps": [{"source": "AMER", "name": "recorded", "timestamp": "2018-06-01T00:00:00.071Z"}, {"source": "APAC", "name": "recorded", "timestamp": "2018-06-01T00:00:00.075Z"}, {"source": "EMEA", "name": "recorded", "timestamp": "2018-06-01T00:00:00.099Z"}], "data": {"body": " (Repeating story first sent on Thursday to additional\nsubscribers)\n    * Sri Lanka wants to be able to review any agreement in 10\nyears\n    * Beijing does not want review in the deal - Sri Lanka\nnegotiator\n    * Colombo rejects Beijing plan for rapid tariff cuts on most\ntrade\n    * Ministerial talks over deal haven't taken place since\nMarch 2017\n    * Lower-level talks make little progress - Sri Lanka\nnegotiator  \n\n    By Shihar Aneez\n    COLOMBO, May 31 (Reuters) - Talks between China and Sri\nLanka for a free trade agreement have hit major hurdles, mainly\nbecause Beijing will not agree to Colombo's demand for a review\nof the deal after 10 years, Sri Lanka's top negotiator said.\n    China has invested billions of dollars building ports and\nroads and power stations in the Indian Ocean island nation just\noff the southern toe of India as part of its Belt and Road\nInitiative to increase its trade and other connections across\nAsia and beyond.\n    But concerns have grown in recent months that such\ninvestments can drive the country of 21 million people deeper\ninto debt and undermine its sovereignty, prompting greater\nscrutiny of deals with China. \n    China's exports to Sri Lanka dwarf the trade that goes in\nthe other direction, leaving Colombo with a big deficit with\nBeijing.\n    Sri Lanka's chief trade negotiator K.J. Weerasinghe said\nthis week that Colombo was insisting on a right to review the\nfree trade pact after ten years, but China was not ready to\nagree that.\n    Ministerial level discussions about an agreement have not\nbeen held since March last year. Lower-level discussions between\nofficials have made little progress, according to Weerasinghe.\n    \"The talks have come to a standstill. China wants to remove\nthe review clause,\" Weerasinghe told Reuters. Beijing was\nopposed to such an option because it wanted longer-term\nstability, he said.    \n    China’s commerce ministry did not respond to Reuters\nrequests for comment. \n    The review clause that Sri Lanka wants would allow it to\nchange some of the deal terms if they were hurting the island\nnation’s local businesses. \n    \n    ANOTHER CONTENTIOUS ISSUE\n    Weerasinghe said another point of contention was that China\nwanted zero tariffs on 90 percent of goods the two countries\nsold to each other as soon as an agreement is signed while\nColombo would rather it started with zero tariffs on only half\nof the products concerned and expanded gradually over 20 years. \n   \n    China has been pushing for free trade pacts with countries\nin the region and last year sealed an agreement with the \nMaldives that drew criticism from opposition political groups in\nthe tropical islands' nation. They said it had been rushed\nthrough parliament with less than an hour of debate.\n    Sri Lanka has previously said it wanted more time to\nnegotiate the free trade deal with China as it is concerned\nabout the economic impact of a rushed deal on its economy.\n    Sri Lanka imported $4.2 billion worth of Chinese goods in\n2016, mostly raw materials for garments, machines and\nelectronics, metals, transport equipment and chemicals. Its\nexports to the world's second largest economy were just $211\nmillion the same year, which included textiles, tea and\nvegetables, footwear and rubber.\n    The 2017 figures for China trade have still not been\nreleased by the Sri Lankan authorities.\n    The trade deficit with China accounted for nearly half of\nthe nation's total deficit in 2016, adding pressure on the\ncountry’s current account deficit, central bank data showed. \n    Sri Lanka’s foreign debt rose nearly 17 percent to 4.72\ntrillion rupees ($30 billion) last year, a fifth of that coming\nfrom loans from China to finance the massive construction\nprogramme across the island.\n    Colombo is separately negotiating a trade pact with India,\nbut that is also moving slowly because Sri Lankan businesses\nfear they will face competition from a flood of cheap goods made\nby Indian firms.  \n\n (Reporting by Shihar Aneez\nEditing by Sanjeev Miglani and Martin Howell)\n ((shihar.aneez@thomsonreuters.com; +94-11-232-5540; Reuters\nMessaging: shihar.aneez.thomsonreuters.com@reuters.net\ntwitter:@shiharaneez))", "mimeType": "text/plain", "pubStatus": "stat:usable", "language": "en", "altId": "nL3N1T24I0", "headline": "RPT-EXCLUSIVE-China's free trade talks with Sri Lanka hit major hurdles ", "takeSequence": 1, "versionCreated": "2018-06-01T00:00:00.000Z", "messageType": 2, "firstCreated": "2018-06-01T00:00:00.000Z", "subjects": ["M:R", "G:1", "G:1J", "G:B1", "G:K", "M:1SJ", "M:1L", "M:2A", "M:1RT", "M:C", "M:EG", "G:5B", "G:CH", "G:S", "G:6", "M:MR", "M:E7", "M:N", "MCCL:OEC", "MCC:OEC", "M:1QD", "N2:TRD", "N2:EMRG", "N2:LK", "N2:CN", "N2:ASIA", "N2:BRI", "N2:NEWS1", "N2:EXCLSV", "N2:TOPNWS", "N2:DIP", "N2:TRF", "N2:IN", "N2:SASIA", "N2:ASXPAC", "N2:EASIA", "N2:TOPCMB", "N2:GEN", "N2:POL"], "audiences": ["NP:C", "NP:D", "NP:E", "NP:M", "NP:O", "NP:T", "NP:U", "NP:MTL", "NP:GRO", "NP:SOF", "NP:OIL", "NP:MNI", "NP:NAT", "NP:CGO", "NP:ELN", "NP:NAW", "NP:G", "NP:SNS", "NP:Z", "NP:PSC", "NP:RBR", "NP:YDB"], "provider": "NS:RTRS", "instancesOf": ["RR:778"], "id": "L3N1T24I0_18060126KJzqNGfMvHg/D2aGR6q2ag4p30BfWSaG2T0B", "urgency": 3}},
{"guid": "L3T1T225L_1806012vrDI1PXIXRUomfOBT1yO3g2dUMwmXSuUEgU8i", "timestamps": [{"source": "AMER", "name": "recorded", "timestamp": "2018-06-01T00:00:00.071Z"}, {"source": "APAC", "name": "recorded", "timestamp": "2018-06-01T00:00:00.091Z"}, {"source": "EMEA", "name": "recorded", "timestamp": "2018-06-01T00:00:00.109Z"}], "data": {"body": " (重溫稿)\n    * 標售標的：央行一年期定存單\n    * 標售時間：6月1日（周五）\n    * 標售金額：1,700億台幣\n    * 預測區間：0.48-0.49%\n    * 受訪機構：六家\n\n    路透台北5月31日 - 台灣央行周五(6月1日)將標售1,700億台幣一年期定存單。路透調\n查結果顯示，該期存單加權平均得標利率預測中值落在0.48-0.49%，大區間則在0.48-0.495\n%；上月的加權平均利率為0.485%，高標則為0.492%。\n    \n    路透周四訪談六家金融機構，包含四家本地銀行、二家外商銀行。本次定存單將於下周\n一(6月4日)發行。\n     \n    台灣央行自2010年4月起按月標售一次1,000億台幣的364天期存單。2014年2月增至1,20\n0億台幣；2015年3月起提高到1,300億台幣、6月起增至1,500億台幣；2016年2月起增至1,60\n0億台幣，僅2017年1月因農曆春節因素而降至1,000億台幣；2017年5月起再增100億至共1,7\n00億。   \n          \n    以下是交易人士的觀點整理：\n    --一大型銀行資調人士指出，估計央行6月將不會升息，此對短率影響中性；至於6月資\n金情勢將會在中旬之後由緊趨松，因此可能不致影響大型銀行業一年期定存單的胃納。目前\n6月季底的因素仍需要觀察。\n    --外商銀行4月大幅匯出後，近期資金持續偏少，不過兩家外商銀交易員認為，一年定\n存單收益是不錯的來源，若短期資金稍少，外商銀應也會做適當調度，運用資金標入定存單\n，因此外商銀對定存單的胃納仍佳。\n    --央行掌控性高的隔夜拆款利率先前一度走高至0.190%，隨後滑落至0.188%，由此可見\n央行並無意讓短率走高。  \n    \n    以下為近年標售結果一覽表:\n    \n {"guid": "L3S1T245Q_1806012XWydSUBfEdHBLzanVVsNIo706VmBEBm3UaRZO", "timestamps": [{"source": "AMER", "name": "recorded", "timestamp": "2018-06-01T00:00:00.103Z"}, {"source": "APAC", "name": "recorded", "timestamp": "2018-06-01T00:00:00.183Z"}, {"source": "EMEA", "name": "recorded", "timestamp": "2018-06-01T00:00:00.131Z"}], "data": {"body": " (重温稿)\n    * 短率稳中透松\n    * 月底加缴税高峰因素迭加，交投活络\n    * 短票利率持稳，高位稍滑落\n    * 债券RP市场需求大，投信走钱\n\n     记者 高洁如\n    路透台北5月31日 - 台湾银行间短率周四稳中透松。资调人士称，今日因大型银行供给\n票券商多数资金，因此虽是月底最末日，又有缴税最末日的数个变数迭加，但整体市况松于\n上日，惟需求也不少，交投活络。\n    \n    大型银行交易员表示，今日虽有大银行以大笔资金买票，不过市场仍有不少需求，要求\n拆入的电话颇为不少。惟市况今日明显稍松，调入容易，市场交投偏热络。\n    \n    〞大行放钱了，小银行可以做货币市场的操作，供应资金的银行比昨天多。〞一位大型\n银行交易员说。           \n    \n    他们认为，今年的营所税金额约2,000亿台币左右，可能在本周四-五和下周一的资金移\n转会最明显；也由于各方认为5月底至6月中旬的税款入库金额将达到最高，市场拆借心态将\n都偏向保守一点。        \n    \n    　           \n 本地时间17:50                    今日报价                  上日收盘\n 台币兑美元<TWD=TP>              29.980                     30.050    \n 台湾加权股价指数<.TWII        10,874.96                  10,821.17    \n >                                                   \n 隔夜银行间拆款加权平均            0.190%                    0.191%\n 利率                                                \n <PIBC><TPITWDOND=>                                  \n   --隔夜拆款利率区间           0.180-0.260%               0.180-0.280%\n   --一周拆款利率区间           0.188-0.430%               0.190-0.430%\n   --两周拆款利率区间           0.310-0.430%               0.220-0.430%\n        \n    \n    **短票利率持稳，高位稍滑落**\n    \n    短票部分，票券商表示，今日大型银行进场供给资金令市况趋松，各票券雨露均沾，令\n资金情势明显好转。\n    \n    他们认为，大型银行的利率30天左右开出0.40%，长达两个月(60天)利率则在0.41%，因\n此压低了平均利率。\n \n    〞主要行库也出来，也让市场放心了，〞一位大型票券商交易员表示。\n               \n    今日30天短票卖断的利率区间在0.40-0.41%，高位0.42%渐少；上日在0.40-0.42%。 \n \n    据集保公司资料，上日自保30天短票成交加权平均利率在0.417%，区间在0.40-0.47%，\n成交金额为126.88亿台币；前日自保30天短票成交加权平均利率在0.415%，区间在0.40-0.4\n2%，成交金额为38.83亿台币。\n \n    在60天短票方面，上日自保60天短票成交加权平均利率在0.415%，区间在0.40-0.42%，\n成交39.06亿台币；前日成交加权平均利率在0.407%，区间在0.36-0.42%，成交30.71亿台币\n。\n    \n    台湾央行周四发行338亿台币定存单，发行余额增4亿台币。周五定存单到期则有993.2\n亿。\n    \n    拆款中心资料<PIBC>显示，周四银行超额准备850亿台币，累计超额准备1兆3,788亿台\n币、加计前期1%的超额准备1兆4,987亿台币。   \n         \n     \n    **债券RP市场需求大**\n    \n    债券附买回(RP)市场方面，大型证券商交易员表示，普遍而言今日市况较先前偏紧，投\n信明显走钱，银行则因要跨月而不供给资金，寿险也保守。\n    \n    〞其实大家都有点缺，但也还好啦，我的缺口本来很大，不过不到10点半也就平了，〞\n一位大型证券商交易员说。\n        \n    他们认为，明日虽是提存期的最末日，但已是月初，投信倒可能受惠月初资金回流，因\n此市况反而可能趋多。 \n     \n    周四有大笔金额交割，包括Morgan Stanley Finance拟发行1.4亿美元债券、QNB Finan\nce拟发行15亿美元债券；周五DBS Bank拟发行1.1亿美元债券、First Abu Dhabi Bank拟发\n行11亿人民币债券。\n    \n    今日证券商与金融机构承做利率区间稍高一些；公债利率主要成交在0.32-0.33%，上日\n在0.31-0.33%；公司债利率则偏向区间高位，区间大致仍在0.40%-0.42%。\n     \n    今日大型票券商与金融机构承作债券利率大致持稳上日；极短天期债券利率在0.23-0.2\n4%；公债RP利率主要在0.28-0.30%；公司债方面利率0.28-0.35%。(完)\n\n    <^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^\nmmt    https://reut.rs/2La9EvQ\n 标售时间：6月1日（周五）\n    * 标售金额：1,700亿台币\n    * 预测区间：0.48-0.49%\n    * 受访机构：六家\n\n    路透台北5月31日 - 台湾央行周五(6月1日)将标售1,700亿台币一年期定存单。路透调\n查结果显示，该期存单加权平均得标利率预测中值落在0.48-0.49%，大区间则在0.48-0.495\n%；上月的加权平均利率为0.485%，高标则为0.492%。\n    \n    路透周四访谈六家金融机构，包含四家本地银行、二家外商银行。本次定存单将于下周\n一(6月4日)发行。\n     \n    台湾央行自2010年4月起按月标售一次1,000亿台币的364天期存单。2014年2月增至1,20\n0亿台币；2015年3月起提高到1,300亿台币、6月起增至1,500亿台币；2016年2月起增至1,60\n0亿台币，仅2017年1月因农历春节因素而降至1,000亿台币；2017年5月起再增100亿至共1,7\n00亿。   \n          \n    以下是交易人士的观点整理：\n    --一大型银行资调人士指出，估计央行6月将不会升息，此对短率影响中性；至于6月资\n金情势将会在中旬之后由紧趋松，因此可能不致影响大型银行业一年期定存单的胃纳。目前\n6月季底的因素仍需要观察。\n    --外商银行4月大幅汇出后，近期资金持续偏少，不过两家外商银交易员认为，一年定\n存单收益是不错的来源，若短期资金稍少，外商银应也会做适当调度，运用资金标入定存单\n，因此外商银对定存单的胃纳仍佳。\n    --央行掌控性高的隔夜拆款利率先前一度走高至0.190%，随后滑落至0.188%，由此可见\n央行并无意让短率走高。  \n    \n    以下为近年标售结果一览表:\n    \n Home prices had been growing by\nmore than 20 percent a year at the peak of the boom.\n    Melbourne saw a drop of 0.5 percent in the month, while\nannual growth slowed to 2.2 percent.\n    Home prices outside the major cities edged up 0.2 percent in\nMay to be 2.2 percent higher on the year. The best performing\ncapital city was Hobart in Tasmania, clocking an annual gain of\n12.7 percent. \n    The slowdown in the major cities follows a tightening in\nstandards on investment and interest-only loans, leading banks\nto raise the interest charged on some mortgage products.\n    The Reserve Bank of Australia has also expressed concern\nthat debt-fuelled speculation in property could ultimately hurt\nboth consumers and banks.\n\n (Reporting by Swati Pandey;\nEditing by Eric Meijer)\n ((swati.pandey@thomsonreuters.com; +61 2 9321 8166; Reuters\nMessaging: swati.pandey.thomsonreuters.com@reuters.net;\ntwitter.com/swatisays))", "mimeType": "text/plain", "pubStatus": "stat:usable", "language": "en", "altId": "nL3N1T271C", "headline": "Australia home prices post first annual fall in six years", "takeSequence": 1, "versionCreated": "2018-06-01T00:00:00.000Z", "messageType": 2, "firstCreated": "2018-06-01T00:00:00.000Z", "subjects": ["A:6", "A:D", "A:E", "B:128", "B:129", "B:1615", "B:77", "E:5", "E:9", "E:D", "G:2H", "G:K", "I:1C", "M:1RT", "A:2", "A:U", "B:125", "B:126", "B:127", "B:261", "B:262", "B:197", "B:255", "B:256", "B:69", "B:75", "E:1", "G:5", "M:MR", "MCCL:OEC", "MCC:OEC", "M:1QD", "N2:REAM", "N2:MTG", "N2:LOA", "N2:BNKS", "N2:COFS", "N2:BNKS1", "N2:HOME", "N2:MCE", "N2:ECI", "N2:REGS", "N2:AU", "N2:ASIA", "N2:HOSAL", "N2:TOPNWS", "N2:DBT", "N2:CDM", "N2:FINS08", "N2:BISV08", "N2:BSVC", "N2:FINS", "N2:BISV", "N2:HSEBLD", "N2:CYCS", "N2:CYCP", "N2:CYCS08", "N2:CYCP08", "N2:BACT", "N2:AUNZ", "N2:TOPCMB"], "audiences": ["NP:ABZ", "NP:AUF", "NP:AUP", "NP:D", "NP:T", "NP:E", "NP:M", "NP:PSC", "NP:RNP", "NP:DNP"], "provider": "NS:RTRS", "instancesOf": [], "id": "L3N1T271C_1806012yfRfpCu4n8sqldteDRBxNDgGlOWAQ0CqYOnPA", "urgency": 3}},

{"guid": "L3N1T2769_1806011ZWLDN/IUtVJhY3woPgqNGeolTnyF9cxZYgF1t", "timestamps": [{"source": "AMER", "name": "recorded", "timestamp": "2018-06-01T00:00:21.556Z"}, {"source": "APAC", "name": "recorded", "timestamp": "2018-06-01T00:00:21.325Z"}, {"source": "EMEA", "name": "recorded", "timestamp": "2018-06-01T00:00:21.381Z"}], "data": {"body": "", "mimeType": "text/plain", "pubStatus": "stat:usable", "language": "en", "altId": "nL3N1T2769", "headline": "SOUTH KOREAN WON <KRW=KFTC> OPENS ONSHORE TRADE AT 1,079.5 PER DOLLAR VS 1,077.7 AT PREVIOUS CLOSE", "takeSequence": 1, "versionCreated": "2018-06-01T00:00:20.000Z", "messageType": 1, "firstCreated": "2018-06-01T00:00:20.000Z", "subjects": ["A:2T", "A:9", "G:1", "G:AE", "G:K", "M:NP", "G:6", "G:S", "R:KRW=", "R:KRW=KFTC", "MCCL:OEC", "MCC:OEC", "M:1QD", "N2:NDFW", "N2:FRX", "N2:EMRG", "N2:KR", "N2:ASIA", "N2:REP", "N2:EASIA", "N2:ASXPAC"], "audiences": ["NP:ABZ", "NP:D", "NP:T", "NP:E", "NP:M", "NP:MF"], "provider": "NS:RTRS", "instancesOf": ["RR:964", "RR:1104"], "id": "L3N1T2769_1806011ZWLDN/IUtVJhY3woPgqNGeolTnyF9cxZYgF1t", "urgency": 1}},
{"guid": "L3N1T276V_1806012teQASUSOFUFZEDjCxPe1mywM9eqhwri0h5gEE", "timestamps": [{"source": "AMER", "name": "recorded", "timestamp": "2018-06-01T00:00:22.837Z"}, {"source": "APAC", "name": "recorded", "timestamp": "2018-06-01T00:00:22.653Z"}, {"source": "EMEA", "name": "recorded", "timestamp": "2018-06-01T00:00:22.724Z"}], "data": {"body": " (Repeats story carried late on Thursday)\n    * Offer of 76 pct stake drew no bid by Thursday evening\ndeadline\n    * Government says to consider changing terms of stake sale\n    * Minister earlier said no extension of bidding deadline\nlikely\n    * Modi needs to find other assets to meet divestment\ntarget-economist\n\n    By Aditi Shah\n    NEW DELHI, May 31 (Reuters) - India's high-profile offer to\nsell a stake in Air India failed to attract a single bidder by\nthe Thursday deadline, dealing a blow to Prime Minister Narendra\nModi's target for offloading stakes in government-held firms.\n    The no-show by buyers in a booming aviation market\nunderlines the challenges the government faces in fixing the\ndebt-laden national carrier, and was a setback for Modi's\ncredentials as a reformer willing to step away from running\nmoney-losing businesses.\n    The government announced a plan in March to divest a 76\npercent stake in Air India and offload about $5.1 billion of its\ndebt, but prospective buyers stayed away, with some citing\nonerous terms as a reason for their lack of interest.\n    The government is now considering changing the terms of the\nsale, the process for which will be re-evaluated in the next two\nweeks, said R.N. Choubey, the top civil servant in the Ministry\nof Civil Aviation. [nFWN1T20O5]\n    \"It did not meet the expectation of participation we had,\"\nChoubey told reporters, adding that his ministry thought giving\n76 percent management control was \"good enough\".\n    Choubey said on Wednesday the government had no plans to\nextend the May 31 deadline. [nD8N1QW002]\n    Earlier this month the government had eased some terms and\nextended the period to make bids, but still found no takers for\nthe airline, which flies some lucrative routes but also has one\nof the industry's highest employees-per-aircraft ratios.\n    Selling the state carrier had been seen as key to Modi's\nplans to divest assets and help keep the fiscal deficit at 3.3\npercent of GDP, a goal already under pressure from giveaways to\nfarmers and other welfare benefits ahead of a national election\nin 2019.\n    Renu Kohli, a Delhi-based independent economist, said the\ngovernment would now need to step up elsewhere to meet its\ndivestment target.\n    \"Relative to what we are seeing this year ... uncertainty in\nthe financial markets, aggravated distress among banks and\nrising interest rates and oil prices, it does not seem like a\nvery supportive time for people to come and buy such an asset,\"\nKohli said, adding that Air India needed large investment.\n    The government may look to raise a record 1 trillion rupees\n($15 billion) from the sale of state assets in the current\nfiscal year that started on April 1, and Air India was expected\nto be a significant contributor. [nL4N1PK4IH]\n    While the government had not set any minimum price, banking\nsources had told Reuters the sale could have fetched between 80\nbillion and 100 billion rupees ($1.2 billion to $1.5 billion).\n[nL3N1RO2WS]\n    \n    \"ONEROUS TERMS\"\n    Air India, known for its Maharaja mascot, has some of\nIndia's most lucrative international and domestic landing and\nparking slots that are key for airlines.\n    While a buyer would have got management control and gained\naccess to more than 2,500 international slots and over 3,700\ndomestic slots, it would also have been required to take on Air\nIndia's 27,000 employees, 40 percent of whom are permanent\nstaff.\n    The terms had also stipulated that the government would have\ncontinued to hold a 24 percent stake, with the need for the\nbidder to abide by conditions, not yet detailed, designed to\nsafeguard employee interests.\n    The government had also restricted merging the airline with\nthe buyer's existing businesses, but later relaxed the rule to\nallow some integration for business efficiency.\n    India's IndiGo Airlines and Jet Airways <JET.NS>, which had\ninitially shown interest, opted out of the race for Air India\nafter the initial terms were disclosed. [nL3N1S81ZQ]\n    Steel-to-autos conglomerate Tata Group, widely seen as a\npotential suitor for Air India, had also decided not to bid as\nthe terms were too onerous, sources told Reuters in April.\n[nL3N1RO2WS]\n    Tata already operates two airlines in India, including\nVistara with Singapore Airlines <SIAL.SI>. Singapore Airlines\nhad in the past said it was keeping an \"open mind\" about Air\nIndia, but sources close to the company have since said it was\nmore focused on growth at Vistara than bidding for the carrier. \n    \"Possibly the current condition is not conducive as the\ndomestic airline industry at large is currently under pressure,\ndriven mainly by the dual impact of rising fuel costs globally\nand weakening currency,\" said Arindam Som, analyst at India\nRatings, a Fitch Group company.\n    ($1 = 67.4625 Indian rupees)\n\n (Reporting by Aditi Shah; Additional reporting by Krishna N.\nDas; Editing by Sanjeev Miglani and Alex Richardson)\n ((aditi.shah@tr.com; +91-11-4954 8023, +91-11-3015 8023;\nReuters Messaging: aditi.shah.thomsonreuters.com@reuters.net;\ntwitter: @aditishahsays))", "mimeType": "text/plain", "pubStatus": "stat:usable", "language": "en", "altId": "nL3N1T276V", "headline": "RPT-UPDATE 2-Air India sale draws a blank in blow to Modi's divestment target", "takeSequence": 1, "versionCreated": "2018-06-01T00:00:21.000Z", "messageType": 2, "firstCreated": "2018-06-01T00:00:21.000Z", "subjects": ["E:4J", "E:4M", "G:1", "G:5B", "G:K", "M:1L", "M:N", "M:1RT", "B:1266", "B:60", "G:7D", "M:Z", "E:5", "B:234", "B:248", "B:34", "B:56", "B:59", "E:1", "E:R", "G:CH", "G:S", "G:2EK", "G:CI", "M:MR", "M:E7", "R:SIAL.SI", "P:4295887850", "R:AIN.UL", "P:5000101844", "MCCL:OEC", "MCC:OEC", "M:1QD", "N2:DVST", "N2:PRIV", "N2:EMRG", "N2:IN", "N2:ASIA", "N2:NEWS1", "N2:POL", "N2:TOPNWS", "N2:AIRL1", "N2:AIRL", "N2:SG", "N2:CMPNY", "N2:MCE", "N2:INDS", "N2:PSSNGR", "N2:INDS08", "N2:TRAN", "N2:AIRS08", "N2:BACT", "N2:DEAL1", "N2:SASIA", "N2:ASXPAC", "N2:ASEAN", "N2:SEASIA", "N2:TOPCMB", "N2:GEN"], "audiences": ["NP:D", "NP:T", "NP:E", "NP:G", "NP:M", "NP:SI", "NP:SNI", "NP:SNS", "NP:PSC", "NP:RNP", "NP:DNP", "NP:PGE", "NP:EBX", "NP:RBR"], "provider": "NS:RTRS", "instancesOf": ["RR:1302", "RR:3181", "RR:778", "RR:133"], "id": "L3N1T276V_1806012teQASUSOFUFZEDjCxPe1mywM9eqhwri0h5gEE", "urgency": 3}},

{"guid": "L2N1T12F3_1806012RiTx0O11hVWXWEVysktAVmFUrfyGj+B318bRn", "timestamps": [{"source": "AMER", "name": "recorded", "timestamp": "2018-06-01T00:00:55.119Z"}, {"source": "APAC", "name": "recorded", "timestamp": "2018-06-01T00:00:55.216Z"}, {"source": "EMEA", "name": "recorded", "timestamp": "2018-06-01T00:00:55.131Z"}], "data": {"body": "    By Diego Oré\n    MEXICO CITY, May 31 (Reuters) - Chinese bike-sharing company\nMobike entered the Latin American market in Mexico City this\nyear drawn by its millions of potential clients. Now it has run\ninto a problem increasingly plaguing the country: street crime.\n    Theft has been so widespread that in the past few days,\ndozens of the app's customers have complained on social media\nabout the lack of available bicycles. Many of them told Reuters\nthey are thinking hard about switching to the competition.\n    Mobike, the largest bike-sharing company in the world, said\nshortages were due to theft as well as growing demand for the\n500 bicycles available in a small part of the capital while it\nawaits clearance from city authorities to expand further.\n    Mobike has been working with law enforcement agencies in\nMexico City to recover the stolen bicycles, said Rene Ojeda,\ndirector of the Mexican arm of the Beijing-based company.\n    Since it entered the Mexican market in mid-February, Mobike\nsubscriptions have risen by 70 percent per week, he said.\n    But the Chinese company faces stiff competition in the\ncapital. Mexican VBike operates with some 2,000 bicycles and\nEcoBici, a bike-sharing firm launched by Mexico City's\ngovernment, has 6,500 units and more than 260,000 users.\n    \"Mobike was a good option for me since I work in the area,\"\nsaid Fernando Galicia, a disgruntled Mobike user in the\nmetropolis. \"But I've gone to EcoBici, and not because it's\ncheaper, but because they always have bikes.\"\n    Arantxa Nava, another Mobike user in Miguel Hidalgo, a\nwealthier borough and the only one where Mobike currently\noperates, complained she \"never\" came across available bikes.\n    Reuters found almost 60 bicycles using the app, which equips\nthem with GPS-trackers, in Tepito, a tough neighborhood north of\nthe historic city center best known for its black markets where\nclothing, pirated films and illegal drugs flow freely.\n    Ojeda said some Mobike users commute to work on the bicycles\nand leave them in Tepito, which is outside its ​operating area.\nBut after reviewing the app at various points this week, Reuters\nfound that none of the Mobikes there ever left Tepito.\n    Thieves are \"using the bikes to move drugs,\" said a Tepito\nresident, who asked to remain anonymous due to security fears.\nTwo other residents of the area corroborated his statement.\n    The Chinese firm did not respond to these allegations.\n    Mobike, which recently changed hands for $2.7 billion,\nequips its bicycles with an electronic alarm that alerts the\ncompany when one of them leaves its operating zone. [nL4N1RH2AR]\n    Each bike also carries more than 60 patented parts so that\nthey cannot be sold for use on other bicycles.\n    For now, the bikes thieves have gotten away with it.\n    Theft is not a problem unique to Mobike in Mexico.\n    This week, business leaders called out the government over a\nrecent crime wave that has hit Mexico and forced several firms\nto shut down operations or spend millions of dollars on security\nin Latin America's second-largest economy. {"guid": "L3N1T300E_1806012zW/GIvUefs0vOjnDGjpICb49uRXnc2cRzzla8", "timestamps": [{"source": "AMER", "name": "recorded", "timestamp": "2018-06-01T00:01:18.775Z"}, {"source": "APAC", "name": "recorded", "timestamp": "2018-06-01T00:01:18.654Z"}, {"source": "EMEA", "name": "recorded", "timestamp": "2018-06-01T00:01:18.709Z"}], "data": {"body": " (Repeats item first carried late on Thursday)\n    * Jan-March GDP +7.7 pct y/y, poll had seen +7.3 pct\n    * 2017/18 growth at 6.7 pct y/y\n    * GDP data comes shortly before c.bank policy decision \n\n    By Neha Dasgupta\n    NEW DELHI, May 31 (Reuters) - The Indian economy grew 7.7\npercent year-on-year in January-March, its quickest pace in\nnearly two years driven by higher growth in manufacturing, the\nfarm sector and construction.\n    The figure surpassed China's growth rate of 6.8 percent in\nthe January-March quarter, confirming India as the fastest\ngrowing major economy.\n    For the fiscal year that ended March 31 <INGDPY=ECI>, the\nMinistry of Statistics reported growth of 6.7 percent, down from\n7.1 percent for a year earlier. However, economists expect\ngrowth to be robust in the current financial year.\n    \"Investment activity has picked up,\" Economic Affairs\nSecretary Subhash Chandra Garg told reporters, adding that the\ngovernment expected a further acceleration in the coming year. \n    India also reported 4.7 percent growth in annual\ninfrastructure output <ININFR=ECI> in April, signalling a\nrecovery after it slipped to a three-year low of 4.2 percent in\n2017/18. [nD8N1S800N]\n    Construction activity jumped to 11.5 percent during\nJanuary-March, after a 3.9 percent drop in the year-ago period.\nAnalysts said this reflected the fading impact of the\ngovernment's move to scrap high-value bank notes that disrupted\nsupply chains and caused job losses.\n    The data may offer a boost to Prime Minister Narendra Modi,\nwho is set to seek a second term next year. His government\nlaunched a nationwide goods and services tax (GST) but its\nintroduction was botched, nearly scuttling India's growth\nprospects in the near term.\n    \"(It) seems like we have moved beyond the teething troubles\nrelated to GST implementation,\" said Tushar Arora, a senior\neconomist at HDFC Bank. \"The pick-up in investment activity is\nalso a good sign.\" \n    The faster pace of growth in the latest quarter might also\nstrengthen expectations of an interest rate increase by the\nIndian central bank when it reviews monetary policy next week.\n    About 40 percent of economists polled by Reuters expected a\nrate rise next week, driven by higher inflation at 4.58 percent\nin April, above the Reserve Bank of India's target of 4 percent\nfor the sixth month in a row. [nL3N1T14CK]     \n    Growth in Asia's third-largest economy, reported by the\nministry, trumped forecasts in a Reuters poll of annual growth\nat 7.3 percent <INGDPQ=ECI>.\n    The ministry revised the October-December annual growth down\nto 7.0 percent from the provisional 7.2 percent it reported\nearlier.\n    \n    DOWNSIDE RISKS \n    India's recovery could be threatened by higher global crude\noil prices <LCOc1>, which this month hit $80 a barrel, their\nhighest since 2014.\n    India meets 80 percent of its oil needs from imports.\n    Higher oil prices have already pressured the rupee <INR=>,\nnear a record low last week and Asia's worst performer.\n    Alongside, rising global trade tensions due to the\nimposition of import tariffs by the United States could moderate\nglobal trade growth, tempering Indian exports, analysts said.\n    \"We have cut our FY19 GDP forecast by 20 basis points taking\ninto account rising oil prices and potential global trade wars,\"\nsaid Teresa John, economist, Nirmal Bang Institutional Equities\nin Mumbai.\n    However, growth is likely to get a boost from monsoon rains,\nwhich hit the southern state of Kerala a few days earlier than\nnormal, potentially brightening the outlook for agricultural\noutput.\n    Monsoons deliver about 70 percent of India's annual rainfall\nand are the lifeblood of its $2.5 trillion economy, spurring\nfarm output and boosting rural spending.    \n   The International Monetary Fund expects economic growth could\nreach 7.4 percent in 2018/19.    \n\n (Reporting by Neha Dasgupta; {"guid": "L3N1SZ1OP_1806012/J/h0QtTZDnC3OBg8nIeog13Ngmf+HLW4cNtp", "timestamps": [{"source": "AMER", "name": "recorded", "timestamp": "2018-06-01T00:05:00.073Z"}, {"source": "APAC", "name": "recorded", "timestamp": "2018-06-01T00:05:00.074Z"}, {"source": "EMEA", "name": "recorded", "timestamp": "2018-06-01T00:05:00.054Z"}], "data": {"body": "    * cpurl://apps.cp./cms/?pageId=stock-index-poll poll data\n\n    By Ayai Tomisawa\n    TOKYO, June 1 (Reuters) - Japanese stocks are forecast to\nrise 4.5 percent this calendar year, extending a bull run that\nbegan in 2012, but worries over global trade and a weak economy\nare expected to limit the upside, a Reuters poll found.\n    Japanese stocks have had a volatile year, by Thursday's\nclose standing 8 percent off a 26-year-high hit on Jan. 23,\nfollowing a fall in the Nikkei benchmark <.N225> to six-week\nlows on Wednesday.\n    Most recently they have been pressured by the Italian\npolitical crisis, the U.S.-China trade spat, and concerns over\nwhether tension between the U.S. and North Korea will be eased.\n    Still, medians from 18 analysts and fund managers polled by\nReuters in the past week suggest stocks will rise again by\nyear-end as investors take on more risk, spurred by a strong\nU.S. economy.\n    The Nikkei share average is expected to trade at 23,800 at\nyear-end, up more than 7 percent from Thursday's close of\n22,201.82, the median forecast shows. It is seen trading at\n24,000 for mid-2019 and 24,500 for end-2019.\n    Forecasts for end-2018 ranged from 21,000 to 26,000. They\nwere 20,000 to 28,500 for mid-2019. In the previous poll in\nFebruary, forecasts ranged from 20,000 to 28,000 for\nend-December 2018.\n    In the United States, the combination of a tightening labour\nmarket and firming inflation supports expectations the Federal\nReserve will raise interest rates next month and again later in\nthe year. That is helping to prop up the dollar.\n    \"Japanese stocks should be supported by a likely strong\ndollar to the yen after the Fed hikes rates, while rising demand\nfor goods is expected to lift consumption in Japan later this\nyear before a planned tax hike next year,\" said Fumio Matsumoto,\na senior fund manager at Dalton Capital Japan.\n    Japan plans to hike sales taxes to 10 percent from 8 percent\nin 2019 and introduce measures to mitigate the impact on the\neconomy, such as tax cuts on home and vehicle purchases.\n    \n    WEAK EARNINGS ESTIMATES\n    Forecasts for Japan Inc's earnings this year are weak,\nsapped by uncertainty over this year's volatile foreign exchange\nrates. For now, most companies base their dollar-yen rate at an\naverage of 105 yen this fiscal year, versus about 109 yen on\nThursday.\n    A weaker yen boosts Japanese manufacturers' profits made\nabroad when repatriated. If the yen trades weaker against the\ndollar, companies' profit estimates are expected to be lifted\nsome time this year.\n    Analysts say companies expect a rise of a mere 2 percent in\npretax profits for the fiscal year ending March 2019, compared\nto gains of 19 percent posted in the previous year.\n    \"Companies' profit forecasts are conservative,\" said\nNobuhiko Kuramochi, a Mizuho Securities strategist who thought\nthe Nikkei would recover its 26-year high of 24,124 as soon as\nJuly.\n    \"Because there are hopes that their April-June earnings will\nbe strong, investors would think that companies will revise up\ntheir annual forecasts and stocks will take heart from that.\"\n    But Kuramochi said the Nikkei was likely to exhaust the\ngains towards year-end, as investors' attention will be back on\nglobal risks. Kuramochi expects the Nikkei to trade at 21,000 in\nend-2018.\n          \n    WEAK ECONOMIC DATA TO KEEP ACTIVITY IN CHECK\n    Data released on Thursday show Japan's industrial output was\nwell short of market expectations in April, adding to fears for\nthe outlook after the economy contracted in the first quarter.\n[nL3N1T12TL]\n    Japan's economy contracted more than expected at the start\nof this year, suggesting growth has peaked after the best run of\nexpansion in decades. [nL3N1SM38M]\n    \"Japan's economy is not faring as strong as we had expected.\nThe market was overly optimistic over exports and capital\nexpenditure,\" said Fujio Ando, senior managing director at\nChibagin Asset Management, who expects the Nikkei to trade\n22,000 at the end of the year, adding that worries over the\nstrong yen are likely to linger.\n    \"If the yen strengthens, the BOJ will probably want to keep\nits policy loose.\"\n    A recent Reuters poll showed the Bank Of Japan was likely to\nwait longer than initially expected to exit its super-easy\nstimulus, with almost half predicting that would not happen\nuntil 2020, or later, given sluggish inflation. [nL3N1SL1EK]\n    For years, the BOJ has desperately tried to fan inflation to\na target of 2 percent by heavy buying of bonds and other assets\nand, more recently, capping borrowing costs at around zero\npercent. Jun (Reuters) - Nordkoreas Machthaber Kim Jong Un\nhat seine Bereitschaft zur atomaren Abrüstung bekräftigt. Sein\nWille zur Denuklearisierung der koreanischen Halbinsel sei\n\"unverändert, beständig und fix\", sagte Kim laut einem Bericht\nder staatlichen Nachrichtenagentur KCNA vom Freitag. Er hoffe,\ndass eine stufenweise Lösung erzielt werde. Das gelte auch für\ndie Beziehungen zu den USA. Kim machte die Äußerungen dem\nBericht nach während eines Treffens mit dem russischen\nAußenminister Sergej Lawrow, der zu Besuch in Nordkorea war. Die\nbeiden hätten sich auch darauf verständigt, den Austausch und\ndie Zusammenarbeit zwischen ihren Ländern zu fördern. Noch in\ndiesem Jahr solle es einen bilateralen Gipfel zwischen Nordkorea\nund Russland geben.\n    Forderungen der USA nach einer einseitigen nuklearen\nAbrüstung Nordkoreas hat die Führung in Pjöngjang\nzurückgewiesen. Auch hat sie für eine phasenweise\nEntnuklearisierung der koreanischen Halbinsel plädiert. \n    Derzeit laufen Vorbereitungen für ein mögliches\nGipfeltreffen zwischen Kim und US-Präsident Donald Trump. Nach\nAngaben von Außenminister Mike Pompeo soll diesen Freitag eine\nnordkoreanische Delegation das Weiße Haus besuchen. Sie werde\nTrump einen Brief Kims überreichen. Trump hatte vergangene Woche\ndas für den 12. Juni geplante Treffen in Singapur zunächst\nabgesagt, dabei jedoch Kim in einem Schreiben aufgefordert, ihn\n\"anzurufen oder zu schreiben\". Inzwischen ist Trump wieder zu\neinem Treffen grundsätzlich bereit. Im Gespräch mit Reuters\nsagte er jedoch, er gehe nicht von einem schnellen Durchbruch\naus.[nL5N1T26XZ] \n\n (Reporterin: Christine Kim\ngeschrieben von Christian Rüttger; bei Rückfragen wenden Sie\nsich bitte an die Redaktionsleitung unter den Telefonnummern:\n069 7565 1236 oder 030 2888 5168)\n ((christian.ruettger@tr.com; +49 30 2888 5152; Reuters\nMessaging: Christian.Ruettger.reuters.com@reuters.net\nwww.twitter.com/REUTERS_DE  www.reuters.de))", "mimeType": "text/plain", "pubStatus": "stat:usable", "language": "de", "altId": "nL5N1T3008", "headline": "Kim Jong Un - Wille nur nuklearen Abrüstung unverändert ", "takeSequence": 2, "versionCreated": "2018-06-01T00:06:24.000Z", "messageType": 6, "firstCreated": "2018-06-01T00:04:59.000Z", "subjects": ["G:1", "G:38", "G:6J", "G:83", "G:AE", "M:2Y", "M:BN", "M:C", "M:EL", "M:LK", "M:MZ", "M:N", "M:1R7", "M:9", "G:A", "G:AJ", "G:B", "G:E", "G:K", "G:S", "G:4", "G:9", "G:6", "M:AJ", "M:E7", "M:B", "MCCL:pl", "MCC:pl", "M:1QD", "N2:EMRG", "N2:RU", "N2:US", "N2:KP", "N2:KR", "N2:INTER", "N2:GEG", "N2:DIP", "N2:CWP", "N2:SECUR", "N2:NUCL", "N2:POL", "N2:POTUS", "N2:VIO", "N2:EUROP", "N2:CISC", "N2:CEEU", "N2:NASIA", "N2:ASIA", "N2:ASXPAC", "N2:AMERS", "N2:NAMER", "N2:EASIA", "N2:WASH", "N2:GEN", "N2:DEF"], "audiences": ["NP:OE", "NP:SWI", "NP:GEA", "NP:GEM", "NP:GER", "NP:OE", "NP:SWI", "NP:GER", "NP:DNP"], "provider": "NS:RTRS", "instancesOf": [], "id": "L5N1T3008_1806016VimL/EaGYpifY8cjrXviMQ7IFxzL4PqxyqNAc", "urgency": 3}},

The firm's\nshares will also resume trading on Friday.\n    The moves come after short seller Blue Orca accused\nSamsonite of questionable accounting practices and was critical\nof how the firm engaged in a number of related party\ntransactions with entities owned by Tainwala. [nL3N1SW15V]\n    The company's shares plunged over 20 percent in two days of\ntrading late last week, leaving it with a valuation of around\n$4.8 billion.\n    Samsonite said previously it reserved the right to take\nlegal action. Tainwala told Reuters in a statement last week the\nfirm maintained a \"very high standard\" of accounting and that\n\"every allegation ... is mischievous and false\".\n    The firm said on Friday Tainwala would no longer be an\nexecutive director and that it was in talks with him about the\nterms of his departure, which would be confirmed at a\nshareholder meeting to be convened \"as soon as practicable\".\n    It said his resignation was \"in the best interests of the\ncompany and its shareholders\".\n    Headquartered in Massachusetts, Samsonite is one of the few\nmajor foreign stocks listed in Hong Kong, alongside Prada\n<1913.HK> and cosmetics firm L'Occitane International <0973.HK>.\n\n\n (Reporting by Adam Jourdan in SHANGHAI and Aaron Saldanha in\nBENGALURU\nEditing by Paul Tait and Stephen Coates)\n ((adam.jourdan@thomsonreuters.com; {"guid": "L3T1T26YJ_1805316GmW2S+5uIafWRN9Pmj0veNM5xwVaZ7NfRyfJy", "timestamps": [{"source": "AMER", "name": "recorded", "timestamp": "2018-06-01T00:07:16.167Z"}, {"source": "APAC", "name": "recorded", "timestamp": "2018-06-01T00:07:16.094Z"}, {"source": "EMEA", "name": "recorded", "timestamp": "2018-06-01T00:07:16.148Z"}], "data": {"body": " (更正：因英文原文有誤，第六段應為...自委內瑞拉進口的石油數量“從2月的1,321萬桶增至1,730萬桶；2月進口量接近2003年1月報告的紀錄低位1,320萬桶。非...自委內瑞拉進口的石油數量“減少逾300萬桶/日，至1,321萬桶/日，接近2003年1月報告的紀錄低位1,320萬桶/日”。)\n    路透5月31日 - 美國能源資料協會(EIA)周四發布的月度報告稱，3月美國原油產量跳增21.5萬桶/日，達到每日1,047萬桶的紀錄高位。\n    \n    德克薩斯州產量增長4%至將近420萬桶/日，為該項數據2005年開始記錄以來的紀錄高點。地處德克薩斯州西部與新墨西哥州東部的二疊紀盆地是美國最大的油田。\n    \n    北達科他州產量約在120萬桶/日，墨西哥灣沿岸產量則下降1.1%至170萬桶/日。\n    \n    EIA還將2月石油產量下修5,000桶/日，至1,026萬桶/日。\n\n    美國原油產量<C-OUT-T-EIA>去年底自1970年代以來首次跨越1,000萬桶/日，超越主要石油出口國沙特阿拉伯<PRODN-SA>，但仍不及俄羅斯。俄羅斯的原油產量略低於1,100萬桶/日<C-RU-OUT>。\n\n    美國3月自委內瑞拉進口的石油數量從2月的1,321萬桶增至1,730萬桶；2月進口量接近2003年1月報告的紀錄低位1,320萬桶。OPEC成員國委內瑞拉因國內政治動盪，石油產量已下降。\n\n    根據報告，美國3月汽油需求為940萬桶/日，較上年同期增加1%或9.4萬桶/日。與此同時，汽油出口較上年同期增加36.1萬桶/日至95.1萬桶/日。\n\n    包括柴油和取暖油在內的美國3月餾分油需求較上年同期增加0.4%或1.5萬桶/日，至420萬桶/日。餾分油出口則同比減少約1.2萬桶/日，至115萬桶/日。\n\n    根據EIA的產量報告，美國本土48州3月天然氣產量升至紀錄新高888億立方英尺/日，刷新2月創下的前次紀錄高位877億立方英尺/日。\n    \n    3月美國最大天然氣產地--德州的產量增加1.3%至227億立方英尺/日，為2016年4月以來最大。\n    \n    3月在第二大天然氣產地--賓夕法尼亞州的產量則降至164億立方英尺/日，較2月的紀錄高位165億下滑0.6%。上年3月產量則為148億。\n    \n    美國自2009年以來是全球最大天然氣生產國，其次為俄羅斯。(完)\n\n    ****如欲參考原文報導,請點選[nL2N1T216V]即可擷取瀏覽****\n\n (編譯 鄭茵/張若琪/戴素萍 審校 張荻/杜明霞)\n ((emmy.tai@thomsonreuters.com; {"guid": "L3S1T26YJ_1805316EfoKf92/+0xr3ssrL9dF2y2H0akjqVZk9wN8X", "timestamps": [{"source": "AMER", "name": "recorded", "timestamp": "2018-06-01T00:07:16.167Z"}, {"source": "APAC", "name": "recorded", "timestamp": "2018-06-01T00:07:16.109Z"}, {"source": "EMEA", "name": "recorded", "timestamp": "2018-06-01T00:07:16.148Z"}], "data": {"body": " (更正：因英文原文有误，第六段应为...自委内瑞拉进口的石油数量“从2月的1,321万桶增至1,730万桶；2月进口量接近2003年1月报告的纪录低位1,320万桶。非...自委内瑞拉进口的石油数量“减少逾300万桶/日，至1,321万桶/日，接近2003年1月报告的纪录低位1,320万桶/日”。)\n    路透5月31日 - 美国能源资料协会(EIA)周四发布的月度报告称，3月美国原油产量跳增21.5万桶/日，达到每日1,047万桶的纪录高位。\n    \n    德克萨斯州产量增长4%至将近420万桶/日，为该项数据2005年开始记录以来的纪录高点。地处德克萨斯州西部与新墨西哥州东部的二叠纪盆地是美国最大的油田。\n    \n    北达科他州产量约在120万桶/日，墨西哥湾沿岸产量则下降1.1%至170万桶/日。\n    \n    EIA还将2月石油产量下修5,000桶/日，至1,026万桶/日。\n\n    美国原油产量<C-OUT-T-EIA>去年底自1970年代以来首次跨越1,000万桶/日，超越主要石油出口国沙特阿拉伯<PRODN-SA>，但仍不及俄罗斯。俄罗斯的原油产量略低于1,100万桶/日<C-RU-OUT>。\n\n    美国3月自委内瑞拉进口的石油数量从2月的1,321万桶增至1,730万桶；2月进口量接近2003年1月报告的纪录低位1,320万桶。OPEC成员国委内瑞拉因国内政治动荡，石油产量已下降。\n\n    根据报告，美国3月汽油需求为940万桶/日，较上年同期增加1%或9.4万桶/日。与此同时，汽油出口较上年同期增加36.1万桶/日至95.1万桶/日。\n\n    包括柴油和取暖油在内的美国3月馏分油需求较上年同期增加0.4%或1.5万桶/日，至420万桶/日。馏分油出口则同比减少约1.2万桶/日，至115万桶/日。\n\n    根据EIA的产量报告，美国本土48州3月天然气产量升至纪录新高888亿立方英尺/日，刷新2月创下的前次纪录高位877亿立方英尺/日。\n    \n    3月美国最大天然气产地--德州的产量增加1.3%至227亿立方英尺/日，为2016年4月以来最大。\n    \n    3月在第二大天然气产地--宾夕法尼亚州的产量则降至164亿立方英尺/日，较2月的纪录高位165亿下滑0.6%。上年3月产量则为148亿。\n    \n    美国自2009年以来是全球最大天然气生产国，其次为俄罗斯。(完)\n\n    ****如欲参考原文报导,请点选[nL2N1T216V]即可撷取浏览****\n\n (编译 郑茵/张若琪/戴素萍 审校 张荻/杜明霞)\n ((emmy.tai@thomsonreuters.com; قالت اللجنة الدولية للصليب\nالأحمر إنها سترسل فريقين من الجراحين المتخصصين في إصابات الحرب\nإلى غزة لإقامة وحدة جراحية في المستشفى الرئيسي بالقطاع لعلاج\nحالات الإصابة الشديدة من الاشتباكات بين القوات الإسرائيلية\nوالفلسطينيين.\n    جنيف - قال مكتب تنسيق الشؤون الإنسانية التابع للأمم المتحدة\nإن القتال في مدينة درنة الليبية تصاعد وبلغ مستويات لم يسبق لها\nمثيل، مع غارات جوية وقصف لمناطق سكنية واشتباكات ضارية على الأرض.\n    بيروت - قال متحدث باسم قوات سوريا الديمقراطية التي تدعمها\nالولايات المتحدة إن الحل العسكري ليس \"هو الحل الذي يقدر أن يوصل\nلأي نتيجة\".\n    بروكسل - قال مفاوض بارز من المعارضة السورية إن انسحاب\nالولايات المتحدة من الاتفاق النووي المبرم من إيران يفتح المجال\nلزيادة الضغط على طهران لوقف دعمها العسكري للرئيس السوري بشار\nالأسد.\n    بيروت - أثار الرئيس السوري بشار الأسد احتمال الصدام مع\nالقوات الأمريكية في سوريا ما لم تأخذ الولايات المتحدة العبرة من\nالعراق وترحل عن سوريا سريعا.\n    بيروت - قال مسؤول لبناني إن لبنان يعمل مع دمشق على إعادة\nآلاف اللاجئين الذين يريدون العودة إلى سوريا.\n    باريس - قال وزير الخارجية الفرنسي إن الاتحاد الأوروبي أحرز\nبعض التقدم بشأن إجراءات لحماية الشركات الأوروبية من العقوبات\nالأمريكية على إيران لكن هذه الإجراءات مازالت غير كافية.\n    على متن طائرة الرئاسة الأمريكية - قال الرئيس الأمريكي دونالد\nترامب إن الأمر قد يتطلب أكثر من لقاء مع زعيم كوريا الشمالية كيم\nجونج أون للتوصل إلى اتفاق بشأن نزع الأسلحة النووية وإنه يود أن\nتفكك بيونجيانج برنامجها النووي بأسرع ما يمكن في ظل أي اتفاق.\n    سول - قالت وكالة الأنباء المركزية الكورية إن رغبة كوريا\nالشمالية في إخلاء شبه الجزيرة الكورية من السلاح النووي لا تزال\n\"دون تغيير ومتسقة وثابتة\".\n    جنيف/يانجون - قالت مفوضية الأمم المتحدة السامية لشؤون\nاللاجئين إنها توصلت لاتفاق إطار مع حكومة ميانمار يستهدف السماح\nلمئات الآلاف من مسلمي الروهينجا الذين لجأوا إلى بنجلادش بالعودة\nطوعا وبأمان.  \n    \n    \n\n            \n\n (إعداد محمد نبيل للنشرة العربية - Brazil\ndepend too much on a small number of players, particularly (star\nforward) Neymar. It's a good team but I don't think they'll get\npast the semifinals.\"\n    Barcelona's Argentinian striker Lionel Messi, who has scored\nover 600 senior career goals for club and country, is expected\nto win the Golden Boot - an award for top goalscorer of the\nchampionship, last won by Colombia's James Rodriguez in Brazil.\n    Bookmakers agreed with strategists. The tightest odds were\n9/2 on both Germany and Brazil to be crowned champions, and\nMessi was favourite to win the Boot.\n      \n  \n    \n    FROM RUSSIA WITH LOVE, AND THAT'S IT\n    Unfortunately for Russia, the poll suggests it has little\nchance of keeping the trophy at home after hosting the expensive\nJune 14 to July 15 showpiece. But most respondents said the\ncountry would at least make it to the round of 16 and the\ncompetition would give a small lift to the economy.\n    World Cup hosts have only lifted the trophy five times in\nthe history of the 88-year old competition: Uruguay in 1930,\nItaly four years later, England in 1966, Argentina in 1978 and\nFrance in 1988.\n    UBS sees a 24 percent probability current title-holder\nGermany wins the July 15 final, with Brazil and Spain the next\nmost likely teams to succeed, with a 19.8 percent and 16.1\npercent chance respectively.\n    The bank's modelling gave a 60 percent chance that one of\nthose three teams would win.\n    A March survey by JP Morgan, conducted with 100 clients at a\nParis conference, also placed Germany as champions.\n    In the Reuters survey Spain got ten nods, fewer than might\nhave been expected for a consistently high-performance side that\nwon in 2010 in South Africa.\n    However, they do face a testing opener against European\nchampions Portugal, a match that will probably determine who\nfinishes top of Group B, which also contains Iran and Morocco.\n\n    PHARAOHS TO REIGN?\n    Egypt, known as \"The Pharaohs\" and returning to the\ntournament after a 28-year absence, are the underdog nation with\nthe best chance of outperforming.\n    But that view may have shifted since last weekend's European\nChampions League final, in which their talisman Mohamed Salah,\nplaying for Liverpool against winners Real Madrid, got injured.\nHe is now a doubt for one or more of Egypt's group games.\n    Some economists relied on their standard econometric\nmodelling skills to predict the World Cup's outcome.\n    \"I guess the point is that in a rational world in which the\nform book rules, one of Brazil or Germany should win,\" said\nPeter Dixon at Commerzbank who ran 10,000 stochastic\nsimulations.\n    \"But somewhere amongst the simulations there may well be a\nuniverse in which Saudi Arabia beats Panama in the final. The\nvery fact there is a random element is one of the reasons why we\nmay well be wrong, and why sports like football hold such a deep\nfascination.\"\n\n    <^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^\nReuters Poll: Which Country Will Win the 2018 FIFA World Cup   \nhttps://reut.rs/2JjVLhi\n    ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^>\n (Additional reporting by Bruno Federowski in BRASILIA and\nAndrey Ostroukh, Zlata Garasyuta in MOSCOW\nGraphic by Indradip Ghosh in BENGALURU; マレーシア国営石油会社ペトロナス[PETR.UL]は３１日、英蘭系ロイヤル・ダッチ・シェル<RDSa.L>が主導するカナダの液化天然ガス（ＬＮＧ）プロジェクトの権益２５％を取得すると発表した。\n    ペトロナスは１年前、天然ガスの供給過剰への懸念から、カナダのブリティッシュコロンビア州に３６０億カナダドル（２８０億米ドル）のＬＮＧ輸出ターミナルを自前で建設する計画を撤回していた。\n    しかし中国、韓国、インドからの需要が予想外に強く、その後は供給過剰への懸念が薄れて、市場心理も上向いている。\n    ペトロナスはブリティッシュコロンビア州キティマットのプロジェクト「ＬＮＧカナダ」の権益を今後数カ月中に取得する。取得金額は公表していない。\n    \n    ＬＮＧカナダは２つのＬＮＧ生産施設で構成される４００億カナダドルの大規模プロジェクトで、年間１３００万トンの輸出を見込む。\n    シェルが４０％を維持し、引き続き最大のオーナーとなる。このほか中国石油天然ガス（ペトロチャイナ）<601857.SS>、三菱商事<8058.T>、韓国ガス公社（ＫＯＧＡＳ）<036460.KS>などが合弁に参加している。\n\n {"guid": "L3T1T26YE_1805316JX/n3m/bSFJD76OALKoNhCmFU60OLfG7PguHM", "timestamps": [{"source": "AMER", "name": "recorded", "timestamp": "2018-06-01T00:15:21.873Z"}, {"source": "APAC", "name": "recorded", "timestamp": "2018-06-01T00:15:21.784Z"}, {"source": "EMEA", "name": "recorded", "timestamp": "2018-06-01T00:15:21.866Z"}], "data": {"body": "    * 內閣部長將於周五宣誓就職\n    * 聯合執政結束了三個月來的政治僵局\n    * 大規模支出計劃讓市場不安\n    * 經濟部長將由一位知名度不高的經濟學家出任\n    * 疑歐派人士薩沃納被提名為歐盟事務部長\n\n    路透羅馬5月31日 - 意大利反建制政黨周四重啟聯合執政計劃，宣布組成新的政府，承諾增加支出、挑戰歐盟的財政規定並控制移民，從而結束了三個月來的政治動盪局面。\n    \n    聯合執政協議消除了重新大選的風險，後者導致本周意大利金融市場遭遇大幅拋售。\n    \n    北方聯盟和五星運動的領導人同意更換原先提名的疑歐派經濟部長人選，之前該提名已被總統否決。\n    \n    在羅馬舉行了數小時磋商後，五星運動領導人迪馬約(Luigi Di Maio)和北方聯盟領導人薩爾維尼(Matteo Salvini)發表聯合聲明稱，“五星運動和北方聯盟組閣的所有條件都已滿足。”\n\n    他們提名的總理人選孔特(Giuseppe Conte)幾個小時後即提交了一份內閣名單。這是孔特八天內第二度獲得授權組閣。他原本是鮮為人知的法學教授，而且從未參選從政，也不是這兩黨任何一黨的黨員。\n\n    “我們決心努力改善所有意大利人的生活品質，”孔特與意大利總統馬塔雷拉會面後對記者說。孔特與五星運動的關係密切。\n    \n    他的內閣成員將在周五宣誓就職。下周，政府在上下議院均將面臨信任投票。\n    \n    政治僵局之所以能夠化解，是因北方聯盟及五星運動同意不讓薩沃納(Paolo Savona)出任經濟部長。現年81歲的薩沃納曾經說過，意大利應該擬定一個放棄歐元的應變計劃。\n    \n    經濟部長人選將改為經濟學教授Giovanni Tria，也是一位知名度不高的人物。\n\n    薩沃納將在政府中擔任歐洲事務部長，雖然角色較小，但仍能允許他與歐盟交涉，並能夠針對歐盟相關議題發表看法。\n    \n    \n    **市場回升**\n    \n    此前，由於擔心重新大選恐將演變成一場意大利是否應退出歐元區的激辯，引發了全球金融市場挫跌，但過去兩天來市況已經回穩。\n    \n    雖然投資者因為免于重新選舉而鬆了一口氣，但他們現在可能再度聚焦于北方聯盟和五星運動的支出計劃，因其可能令政府債務更為沉重。\n    \n    兩黨在第一次同意共組政府所發表的聯合政綱中也表示，將促使歐盟重新檢視財政規定，薩沃納甚至稱這些規定“奴役”了意大利人。\n    \n    薩爾維尼將擔任內政部長，迪馬約則將出任一個新設立但極有權力的聯合部長職位，主管勞工和工業事務。(完)\n\n    ****如欲參考原文報導，請點選[nL5N1T2334]即可擷取瀏覽****\n\n (編譯 張荻/李婷儀 審校 鄭茵/杜明霞/徐文焰)\n ((tina.li1@thomsonreuters.com; {"guid": "L3S1T26YE_1805316MP9OcVa02eZdtwACae1VfWLpTwiZ1zQcPiHyK", "timestamps": [{"source": "AMER", "name": "recorded", "timestamp": "2018-06-01T00:15:21.873Z"}, {"source": "APAC", "name": "recorded", "timestamp": "2018-06-01T00:15:21.816Z"}, {"source": "EMEA", "name": "recorded", "timestamp": "2018-06-01T00:15:21.881Z"}], "data": {"body": "    * 内阁部长将于周五宣誓就职\n    * 联合执政结束了三个月来的政治僵局\n    * 大规模支出计划让市场不安\n    * 经济部长将由一位知名度不高的经济学家出任\n    * 疑欧派人士萨沃纳被提名为欧盟事务部长\n\n    路透罗马5月31日 - 意大利反建制政党周四重启联合执政计划，宣布组成新的政府，承诺增加支出、挑战欧盟的财政规定并控制移民，从而结束了三个月来的政治动荡局面。\n    \n    联合执政协议消除了重新大选的风险，后者导致本周意大利金融市场遭遇大幅抛售。\n    \n    北方联盟和五星运动的领导人同意更换原先提名的疑欧派经济部长人选，之前该提名已被总统否决。\n    \n    在罗马举行了数小时磋商后，五星运动领导人迪马约(Luigi Di Maio)和北方联盟领导人萨尔维尼(Matteo Salvini)发表联合声明称，“五星运动和北方联盟组阁的所有条件都已满足。”\n\n    他们提名的总理人选孔特(Giuseppe Conte)几个小时后即提交了一份内阁名单。这是孔特八天内第二度获得授权组阁。他原本是鲜为人知的法学教授，而且从未参选从政，也不是这两党任何一党的党员。\n\n    “我们决心努力改善所有意大利人的生活品质，”孔特与意大利总统马塔雷拉会面后对记者说。孔特与五星运动的关系密切。\n    \n    他的内阁成员将在周五宣誓就职。下周，政府在上下议院均将面临信任投票。\n    \n    政治僵局之所以能够化解，是因北方联盟及五星运动同意不让萨沃纳(Paolo Savona)出任经济部长。现年81岁的萨沃纳曾经说过，意大利应该拟定一个放弃欧元的应变计划。\n    \n    经济部长人选将改为经济学教授Giovanni Tria，也是一位知名度不高的人物。\n\n    萨沃纳将在政府中担任欧洲事务部长，虽然角色较小，但仍能允许他与欧盟交涉，并能够针对欧盟相关议题发表看法。\n    \n    \n    **市场回升**\n    \n    此前，由于担心重新大选恐将演变成一场意大利是否应退出欧元区的激辩，引发了全球金融市场挫跌，但过去两天来市况已经回稳。\n    \n    虽然投资者因为免于重新选举而松了一口气，但他们现在可能再度聚焦于北方联盟和五星运动的支出计划，因其可能令政府债务更为沉重。\n    \n    两党在第一次同意共组政府所发表的联合政纲中也表示，将促使欧盟重新检视财政规定，萨沃纳甚至称这些规定“奴役”了意大利人。\n    \n    萨尔维尼将担任内政部长，迪马约则将出任一个新设立但极有权力的联合部长职位，主管劳工和工业事务。(完)\n\n    ****如欲参考原文报导，请点选[nL5N1T2334]即可撷取浏览****\n\n (编译 张荻/李婷仪 审校 郑茵/杜明霞/徐文焰)\n ((tina.li1@thomsonreuters.com; {"guid": "L3T1T274Y_1806016CJ24p+y4dDGNpmK6wvb7x6yS61VmdclsSL9MZ", "timestamps": [{"source": "AMER", "name": "recorded", "timestamp": "2018-06-01T00:15:46.107Z"}, {"source": "APAC", "name": "recorded", "timestamp": "2018-06-01T00:15:46.019Z"}, {"source": "EMEA", "name": "recorded", "timestamp": "2018-06-01T00:15:46.088Z"}], "data": {"body": "    路透科倫坡6月1日 - 斯里蘭卡的高級談判官員稱，中國和斯里蘭卡之間的自由貿易協定談判遇到重大障礙，主要因為中方不同意斯方提出的十年後要審查自貿協定的要求。\n\n    中國向斯里蘭卡投資了數以十億計美元，修建港口、公路和發電站，為“一帶一路”倡議的內容之一。\n\n    但近幾個月，有人擔心這類投資會令斯里蘭卡債務增加，主權受到損害，促使斯方加大對與中國交易的審查。\n    \n    中國對斯里蘭卡存在巨大的貿易順差。\n\n    斯里蘭卡的首席貿易談判代表K.J. Weerasinghe本周稱，斯里蘭卡堅持要有十年後審查自貿協定的權利，但中國不打算同意。\n \n    自去年3月起兩國就沒有舉行過部長級磋商。據Weerasinghe表示，低級別官員的討論也沒有取得多少進展。\n    \n    Weerasinghe對路透表示，“談判已經陷入了僵局。中國希望去除重新評估條款。”他並稱，北京反對這個選項，是因其希望長期的穩定性。\n    \n    中國商務部未回復路透的置評請求。\n    \n    Weerasinghe還表示，另一個存在爭議之處是，中國希望自貿協議一經簽署，兩國間90%的商品貿易都實現零關稅，而斯里蘭卡則希望僅對50%的產品實現零關稅，並在20年內逐步擴大零關稅的範圍。(完)\n\n    ****如欲參考原文報導,請點選[nL3N1SO1UH]即可擷取瀏覽****\n\n (編譯 白雲/張荻； 審校 張若琪/李婷儀)\n ((patrick.zhang@thomsonreuters.com; 86-10-66271040; Reuters\nMessaging: patrick.zhang.thomsonreuters.com@reuters.net))", "mimeType": "text/plain", "pubStatus": "stat:usable", "language": "zh", "altId": "nL3T1T274Y", "headline": "《獨家新聞》中國與斯里蘭卡的自貿協定談判遇到重大障礙", "takeSequence": 2, "versionCreated": "2018-06-01T00:15:45.000Z", "messageType": 6, "firstCreated": "2018-06-01T00:14:24.000Z", "subjects": ["E:5", "G:1", "G:1J", "G:5B", "G:6", "G:B1", "G:CH", "G:K", "G:S", "I:1U", "M:1A", "M:1SJ", "M:2A", "M:BG", "M:C", "M:E7", "M:EG", "M:N", "M:R", "M:1QD", "N2:MCE", "N2:EMRG", "N2:LK", "N2:IN", "N2:EASIA", "N2:CN", "N2:SASIA", "N2:ASIA", "N2:ASXPAC", "N2:TRACC", "N2:TRN", "N2:BRI", "N2:EXCLSV", "N2:CNEWS", "N2:DIP", "N2:GEN", "N2:TRF", "N2:POL", "N2:TRD"], "audiences": ["NP:CLN", "NP:CMF", "NP:CMN"], "provider": "NS:RTRS", "instancesOf": [], "id": "L3T1T274Y_1806016CJ24p+y4dDGNpmK6wvb7x6yS61VmdclsSL9MZ", "urgency": 3}},

{"guid": "L3N1T26WJ_1806012NXJyyozFEaFpYtkSrT3UuB9jYTMR0RRTNq1Bi", "timestamps": [{"source": "AMER", "name": "recorded", "timestamp": "2018-06-01T00:17:54.014Z"}, {"source": "APAC", "name": "recorded", "timestamp": "2018-06-01T00:17:53.957Z"}, {"source": "EMEA", "name": "recorded", "timestamp": "2018-06-01T00:17:54.005Z"}], "data": {"body": "    * NZ Q1 terms of trade fall 1.9 pct from record high\n    * First fall since Q3 2016\n    * Falling dairy exports weigh on index\n\n (Re-casts, adds detail, market reaction)\n    WELLINGTON, June 1 (Reuters) - New Zealand's terms of trade\nfell for the first time in more than a year in the March\nquarter, dropping by 1.9 percent from a record high as softer\ndairy prices pulled down export values, official data showed on\nFriday.\n    Export prices fell 2.2 percent while imports edged down 0.3\npercent, Statistics New Zealand said.\n    Economists were expecting a 1.5 percent fall, with export\nprices down 1.5 percent and import costs unchanged, a Reuters\npoll found. \n    The New Zealand dollar <NZD=D4> was largely unchanged after\nthe data, hovering around $0.7008.\n    The fall was the first since September 2016. It was led by\nweaker values for dairy - the country's top goods export - with\nprices falling 6.7 percent. \n    Global dairy prices eased towards the end of 2017 on\nincreased global supply, which took a few months to filter\nthrough to New Zealand exports. Economists expect a stronger \noutlook because global milk prices have since picked up.\n    \"The overall picture is that the terms of trade have come\noff a very high level, but ... more recent developments are more\nsupportive of export prices, which will be generally keeping\npace with import prices,\" said Miles Workman, economist at ANZ\nBank.\n    The dip from fourth-quarter 2017's record high vindicated\nthe Reserve Bank of New Zealand's cautious monetary policy of\nkeeping interest rates at an historic low of 1.75 percent\nindefinitely to boost soft inflation even as economic growth\nremains robust.\n\n    \n    \n\n\n (Reporting by Charlotte Greenfield;\nEditing by Eric Meijer)\n ((charlotte.greenfield@thomsonreuters.com; +64212437821;\nReuters Messaging:\ncharlotte.greenfield.thomsonreuters.com@reuters.net))", "mimeType": "text/plain", "pubStatus": "stat:usable", "language": "en", "altId": "nL3N1T26WJ", "headline": "UPDATE 1-NZ terms of trade fall in Q1 as weak dairy export prices weigh", "takeSequence": 1, "versionCreated": "2018-06-01T00:17:53.000Z", "messageType": 2, "firstCreated": "2018-06-01T00:17:53.000Z", "subjects": ["E:5", "E:9", "G:49", "G:K", "I:1U", "M:ML", "G:5", "R:NZEXPP=ECI", "R:NZEXPQ=ECI", "R:NZIMPP=ECI", "R:NZTOTQ=ECI", "M:1QD", "N2:MCE", "N2:ECI", "N2:NZ", "N2:ASIA", "N2:TRACC", "N2:AGA", "N2:AUNZ"], "audiences": ["NP:D", "NP:T", "NP:E", "NP:M", "NP:AUF", "NP:AUP", "NP:PSC", "NP:RNP", "NP:DNP", "NP:PTD"], "provider": "NS:RTRS", "instancesOf": [], "id": "L3N1T26WJ_1806012NXJyyozFEaFpYtkSrT3UuB9jYTMR0RRTNq1Bi", "urgency": 3}},

＜０９：１１＞　寄り付きの日経平均は反落、ＥＵなどへの米追加関税巡る懸念が重\nし\n    \n    寄り付きの東京株式市場で、日経平均株価は前日比７５円５７銭安の２万２１２６円\n２５銭となり、反落して始まった。\n    \n {"guid": "L3T1T303B_1806012EJYBn9PhbTcjkNgNZirNJxVajzvIRfO2zXuq7", "timestamps": [{"source": "AMER", "name": "recorded", "timestamp": "2018-06-01T00:20:39.781Z"}, {"source": "APAC", "name": "recorded", "timestamp": "2018-06-01T00:20:39.708Z"}, {"source": "EMEA", "name": "recorded", "timestamp": "2018-06-01T00:20:39.761Z"}], "data": {"body": "    路透上海6月1日 - 據上海證券交易所網站周四稍晚刊登的新聞稿，在MSCI指數納入A股前一交易日，上交所全力維護市場穩定運行，基本實現了A股納入MSCI指數的平穩過渡，國際上主要被動型基金已完成建倉。\n    \n    據上交所統計，周四滬市MSCI納A板塊上漲1.81%，成交760億元人民幣，較上一交易日增加14%。通過滬股通流入MSCI納A板塊的金額明顯放大，買入金額增加至112.7億元，創年內單日最高，約為近一個月平均水平（44億元）的2.5倍；其中尾市五分鐘通過滬股通買入MSCI板塊的金額為20.28億元。\n    \n    上海證券交易所總經理蔣鋒表示，上交所將繼續堅持市場化、法治化、國際化的改革方向，積極探索交易所國際化的新模式、新機制、新思路，努力建設成為與中國特色社會主義現代化強國相匹配的世界領先交易所，推進中國資本市場向現代化的、既具有中國特色、更富有全球競爭力的多層次資本市場邁進。\n    \n    新聞稿引述MSCI董事局主席兼首席執行官亨利•費爾南德茲的話稱，“未來，MSCI將努力理解並鼓勵（中國）這些資本市場改革開放的步伐。我希望這可以推動中國A股以更少的步驟更大的規模納入MSCI。”\n    \n    費爾南德茲在接受國內媒體採訪時還表示，不管以什麼形式在A股上市，只要滿足流動性等方面的要求，MSCI就會考慮按照指數設定將這只個股納入指數中，不排除未來會納入創業板及CDR（存托賃證）渠道上市的新經濟A股。\n    \n    在剔除部分停牌股後，MSCI明晟周五把226只中國大型股納入其全球和地區指數中。這234只A股的初始納入因子為2.5%，總計占MSCI明晟新興市場指數0.39%的權重；第二階段將在9月進行，納入因子提高至5%。（完）\n\n (發稿 林琦 ;審校 喬艷紅)\n ((路透中文新聞部:+86-21-61041787;傳真 86-21-61041728 ;qi.lin@thomsonreuters.com; Reuters\nMessaging: qi.lin.thomsonreuters.com@reuters.net))", "mimeType": "text/plain", "pubStatus": "stat:usable", "language": "zh", "altId": "nL3T1T303B", "headline": "中國證券：實現MSCI納A的平穩過渡，主要被動基金已完成建倉--上證所", "takeSequence": 1, "versionCreated": "2018-06-01T00:20:39.000Z", "messageType": 2, "firstCreated": "2018-06-01T00:20:39.000Z", "subjects": ["G:B1", "G:K", "G:1", "A:1", "G:3H", "G:6", "G:S", "M:1QD", "N2:CN", "N2:ASIA", "N2:EMRG", "N2:STX", "N2:HK", "N2:EASIA", "N2:ASXPAC"], "audiences": ["NP:CMN", "NP:CMF", "NP:CLN", "NP:DNP", "NP:CDS"], "provider": "NS:RTRS", "instancesOf": [], "id": "L3T1T303B_1806012EJYBn9PhbTcjkNgNZirNJxVajzvIRfO2zXuq7", "urgency": 3}},

{"guid": "L3N1T271M_1806012dufwCincYZ8CAoCadjkgBIUqrDKPHQ6REuiQ1", "timestamps": [{"source": "AMER", "name": "recorded", "timestamp": "2018-06-01T00:23:05.500Z"}, {"source": "APAC", "name": "recorded", "timestamp": "2018-06-01T00:23:05.428Z"}, {"source": "EMEA", "name": "recorded", "timestamp": "2018-06-01T00:23:05.465Z"}], "data": {"body": "    By Naveen Thukral\n    SINGAPORE, June 1 (Reuters) - U.S. crude oil steadied on\nFriday after deep losses in the previous session on pressure\nfrom all-time high U.S. production and expectations of higher\nOPEC output.\n    U.S. West Texas Intermediate crude <CLc1> rose 2 cents to\n$67.06 a barrel by 0805 GMT after dropping almost 2 percent on\nThursday. Brent crude <LCOc1>, which was little changed in the\nprevious session, added 17 cents, or 0.2 percent, to $77.73 per\nbarrel.\n    U.S. crude production has been rising to record high levels\nsince late last year. In March it jumped 215,000 bpd to 10.47\nmillion bpd, a new monthly record, the Energy Information\nAdministration (EIA) said on Thursday. [nL2N1T216V]\n    Still, U.S. crude stockpiles fell 3.6 million barrels last\nweek, the EIA said, exceeding expectations for a decline of\n525,000 barrels. [EIA/S]\n    \"A drop in inventories in the U.S. was overshadowed by U.S.\noutput which jumped to a record high level,\" ANZ said in a note.\n    \"With the markets still concerned about supply-side issues\nin OPEC, this has pushed the Brent-WTI spread out to nearly\n$11/bbl, the highest level for three years.\"\n    Brent hit a three-week low below $75 a barrel on Monday\nafter OPEC and its allies, including Russia, indicated they\ncould adjust their deal to curb supplies and increase\nproduction, but recovered later in the week.\n    OPEC and non-OPEC producers have committed to cut output by\n1.8 million bpd until the end of 2018 but are ready to make\ngradual supply adjustments to deal with shortages, a Gulf source\nfamiliar with Saudi thinking told Reuters late on Wednesday.\n    Sources told Reuters last week that Saudi Arabia, the\neffective leader of OPEC, and Russia were discussing boosting\noutput by about 1 million bpd to compensate for losses in supply\nfrom Venezuela and to address concerns about the impact of U.S.\nsanctions on Iranian output.\n    Russia would be able to raise its oil output back to pre-cut\nlevels within months if there is a decision to unwind the\nprice-protection deal with OPEC and other producers, a Russian\nenergy ministry official said. [nL5N1T14XZ]\n     Concerns about U.S. bottlenecks are contributing to the\ndecline in U.S. futures as well. Prices for physical barrels of\nU.S. light sweet crude delivered at Midland are at their largest\ndiscount to the benchmark U.S. futures price in almost four\nyears.\n    \n\n (Reporting by Naveen Thukral; editing by Richard Pullin)\n ((naveen.thukral@thomsonreuters.com; +65-6870-3829; Reuters\nMessaging: naveen.thukral.thomsonreuters.com@reuters.net))", "mimeType": "text/plain", "pubStatus": "stat:usable", "language": "en", "altId": "nL3N1T271M", "headline": "U.S. crude oil little changed after losses, record output weighs", "takeSequence": 1, "versionCreated": "2018-06-01T00:23:05.000Z", "messageType": 2, "firstCreated": "2018-06-01T00:23:05.000Z", "subjects": ["A:4", "G:3", "G:6J", "G:7J", "G:A", "G:Q", "M:3F", "M:NP", "U:24", "U:45", "U:C", "G:4", "G:9", "R:CLc1", "R:LCOc1", "MCCL:OEC", "MCC:OEC", "M:1QD", "N2:COM", "N2:WEU", "N2:US", "N2:GB", "N2:EUROP", "N2:MEAST", "N2:MKTREP", "N2:REP", "N2:PROD", "N2:CRU", "N2:NRG", "N2:AMERS", "N2:NAMER"], "audiences": ["NP:C", "NP:D", "NP:E", "NP:M", "NP:O", "NP:T", "NP:U", "NP:OIL", "NP:NAT", "NP:UKI", "NP:GRO", "NP:MTL", "NP:SOF", "NP:GFN", "NP:J", "NP:MF", "NP:EMK", "NP:Z", "NP:RNP", "NP:DNP", "NP:PTD", "NP:PEN", "NP:EBX", "NP:RBR"], "provider": "NS:RTRS", "instancesOf": ["RR:1900", "RR:529", "NI:O/N", "NI:O/R"], "id": "L3N1T271M_1806012dufwCincYZ8CAoCadjkgBIUqrDKPHQ6REuiQ1", "urgency": 3}},

1.中國的GDP增長率已根據通貨膨脹率進行調整，而固定資產投資增長率及社會消費品零售總額增長率為名義增長率。\n     2.中國國家統計局2017年1月公告，決定對現行的國內生產總值(GDP)核算和數據發布制度進行精簡改革，由目前初步核算、初步核實和最終核實三個步驟調整為初步核算和\n最終核實兩個步驟，並按規定發布。\n     3.國家統計局從2011年1月起提高工業、固定資產投資統計起點標準，其中納入規模以上工業統計範圍的工業企業起點標準從年主營業務收入500萬元提高到2,000萬元；固\n定資產投資項目統計的起點標準，從計劃總投資額50萬元提高到500萬元。\n     4.國家外匯管理局公布的2015年3月末中國全口徑外債數據，首次將人民幣外債納入其中，此前中國外債統計中未包括人民幣對外負債。\n     5.中國央行自2015年7月起按照國際貨幣基金組織數據公布特殊標準（SDDS）按月發布官方儲備資產數據，一般不晚于每月初第7日發布上月數據。(完)\n\n (發稿 張金棟；審校 林高麗)\n ((xiaochong.zhang@thomsonreuters.com; 0086-10-66271042; Reuters Messaging: 5.中国央行自2015年7月起按照国际货币基金组织数据公布特殊标准（SDDS）按月发布官方储备资产数据，一般不晚于每月初第7日发布上月数据。(完)\n\n (发稿 张金栋；审校 林高丽)\n ((xiaochong.zhang@thomsonreuters.com; 0086-10-66271042; Reuters Messaging: En avril, le marché avait\nprogressé de 9%, donnant une hausse cumulée de 4,4% sur quatre\nmois.\n    Avec les chiffres de mai, les immatriculations de voitures\nneuves en France ressortent désormais en progression de 3,49%\nsur les cinq premiers mois de l'année.\n    Si la deuxième partie de 2018 s'annonce plus incertaine, le\nmarché automobile français devrait connaître sa quatrième année\nde croissance consécutive et retrouver son niveau d'avant-crise,\nà 2,2 millions d'unités environ.\n    AAA Data prévoit une hausse de 3,95% des immatriculations\nsur l'ensemble de l'année et l'Observatoire Cetelem de\nl'automobile +3,8%, tandis que le CCFA, plus prudent, anticipe\nun marché en progression d'environ 2%.\n    En 2017, la croissance des immatriculations en France a\natteint 4,7%, tirée par l'embellie des perspectives économiques\net l'engouement pour les nouveaux SUV. En 2016, le marché avait\nprogressé de 5,1% après +6,8% en 2015.\n    Cette série faste est venue interrompre cinq années de\nstagnation ou de baisse consécutives notamment au contrecoup de\nla fin des primes à la casse, instaurées face à la crise de\n2008-2009.\n    En mai, les immatriculations du groupe PSA <PEUP.PA>, qui\nregroupe maintenant les marques Peugeot, Citroën, DS et\nOpel/Vauxhall, ont progressé de 9,88% tandis que celles du\ngroupe Renault <RENA.PA> (marques Renault, Dacia et Alpine) ont\nenregistré une hausse de +0,69%.\n\n (Nicolas Delame et Gilles Guillaume)\n ((paris.newsroom@reuters.com;; + 33 1 49 49 53 34;))", "mimeType": "text/plain", "pubStatus": "stat:usable", "language": "fr", "altId": "nL5N1T301E", "headline": "France-Immatriculations de voitures neuves en hausse de 0,15%-CCFA", "takeSequence": 1, "versionCreated": "2018-06-01T00:26:42.000Z", "messageType": 2, "firstCreated": "2018-06-01T00:22:05.000Z", "subjects": ["M:BR", "M:1A", "B:1292", "B:72", "G:5M", "M:Z", "G:3D", "E:G", "E:Q", "I:1G", "B:255", "B:69", "B:71", "E:1", "G:3", "G:A", "G:AL", "G:B", "E:5", "MCCL:I", "MCC:I", "M:1QD", "N2:INGE", "N2:TRN", "N2:CARM1", "N2:CARM", "N2:FR", "N2:CMPNY", "N2:DE", "N2:RES", "N2:RESF", "N2:CARREG", "N2:CYCS", "N2:CYCS08", "N2:AUTO", "N2:BACT", "N2:WEU", "N2:EUROP", "N2:EZC", "N2:CEEU", "N2:MCE"], "audiences": ["NP:FA", "NP:SWF", "NP:FB", "NP:DNP"], "provider": "NS:RTRS", "instancesOf": [], "id": "L5N1T301E_18060129LXgOUaanFcvdfFrHEziS7cKzsE3AtVKfuwwD", "urgency": 3}},

{"guid": "L2N1T22BW_180601299hiSGEiA2CPQMRXLhEcGWQApC/YSu/NbBSz8", "timestamps": [{"source": "AMER", "name": "recorded", "timestamp": "2018-06-01T00:29:00.237Z"}, {"source": "APAC", "name": "recorded", "timestamp": "2018-06-01T00:29:00.321Z"}, {"source": "EMEA", "name": "recorded", "timestamp": "2018-06-01T00:29:00.247Z"}], "data": {"body": " (Updates death toll from police source, adds election chief\nresignation, government response)\n    By Oswaldo Rivas\n    MANAGUA, May 31 (Reuters) - Fifteen people were killed and\nmore than 200 injured on Wednesday in one of the worst days of\nviolence since protests against Nicaraguan President Daniel\nOrtega began more than a month ago, police said on Thursday.\n    The bloodshed was condemned by the Central American\ncountry's Episcopal conference of Catholic bishops, which called\nit \"organized and systematic aggression\" and suspended talks\nwith the government that had been scheduled for Thursday.\n    Witnesses said pro-government armed groups opened fire on\nthe marchers during a demonstration on Wednesday, Nicaragua's\nMother's Day. The march was held to remember the children who\nwere among the more than 80 killed since the start of protests.\n    \"The number of people killed as a product of the actions of\ndelinquent groups who operate wearing masks is 15,\" said\nNational Police Sub-Director Francisco Diaz, saying seven of\nthose died in the capital, Managua. He said 218 people were\ninjured. \n    The army said it was treating some of the injured, including\nseveral police officers.\n    The government denied allegations by rights groups that the\naggressors were government supporters and said it bore no\nresponsibility for the violence since the student-led protests\nstarted in April, triggered by proposed changes to the social\nsecurity system.\n    The European Parliament on Thursday condemned what it called\n\"brutal repression\" in Nicaragua and called for elections,\nechoing calls for Ortega to move the 2021 presidential election\nearlier.\n    In a sign Ortega was responding to international pressure,\nthe government and the Organization of American states issued a\nstatement saying the head of the electoral commission, Roberto\nRivas, had resigned. \n    In December, the United States imposed sanctions on Rivas,\nciting allegations he amassed wealth beyond his income including\nprivate jets and yachts, and accusing him of electoral fraud. \n    Ortega was elected for a third consecutive term in 2016 with\nmore than 70 percent of the vote, a result questioned by\nobservers who said the government had suppressed opposition. \n    In a letter to Ortega published on Twitter, business\nassociation COSEP urged the 72-year-old president to push up the\n 2021 vote to a date agreed on by the government and civilian\nrepresentatives.\n    \"Given the magnitude of this crisis, we urge you to\nundertake every effort in your power to find a peaceful solution\nbefore we find ourselves immersed in an even more tragic\nsituation,\" the letter said.\n    Ortega told supporters in response to COSEP that Nicaragua\n\"is not private property,\" newspaper La Prensa reported.\n\n (Reporting by Oswaldo Rivas; Additional reporting by Delphine\nSchrank and Tomas Bravo in Mexico City; Editing by Frank Jack\nDaniel and Peter Cooney)\n ((frank.daniel@thomsonreuters.com; +52 55 5282 7137; Reuters\nMessaging: frank.daniel.thomsonreuters.com@reuters.net))", "mimeType": "text/plain", "pubStatus": "stat:usable", "language": "en", "altId": "nL2N1T22BW", "headline": "UPDATE 1-Fifteen killed in Nicaragua protests, including Mother's Day march attack", "takeSequence": 1, "versionCreated": "2018-06-01T00:28:59.000Z", "messageType": 2, "firstCreated": "2018-06-01T00:28:59.000Z", "subjects": ["G:4", "G:G", "M:1L", "M:9", "M:A", "M:G", "M:K", "M:N5", "M:RA", "G:AC", "M:LK", "G:7", "M:E7", "M:EL", "M:ES", "M:N", "M:DU", "MCCL:OVR", "MCC:OVR", "M:1QD", "N2:AMERS", "N2:LATAM", "N2:NEWS1", "N2:VIO", "N2:CRIM", "N2:VOTE", "N2:EU", "N2:CIV", "N2:VOTP", "N2:NI", "N2:SECUR", "N2:CAMER", "N2:GEN", "N2:CWP", "N2:CLJ", "N2:POL", "N2:INTAG"], "audiences": ["NP:G", "NP:EMK", "NP:PSC", "NP:RNP", "NP:PGE", "NP:RAST", "NP:YDB"], "provider": "NS:RTRS", "instancesOf": [], "id": "L2N1T22BW_180601299hiSGEiA2CPQMRXLhEcGWQApC/YSu/NbBSz8", "urgency": 3}},

{"guid": "L3N1SG09I_1806012U1EE/XHTp7PggSmi8JQRhgn9+I82uXqJMd3Oq", "timestamps": [{"source": "AMER", "name": "recorded", "timestamp": "2018-06-01T00:30:00.081Z"}, {"source": "APAC", "name": "recorded", "timestamp": "2018-06-01T00:30:00.103Z"}, {"source": "EMEA", "name": "recorded", "timestamp": "2018-06-01T00:30:00.107Z"}], "data": {"body": "    * New Zealand targets 100 pct renewable power by 2035\n    * New Zealand aims to be carbon neutral by 2050\n    * Government has banned new offshore oil, gas exploration\npermits\n    * Much higher power prices needed to reach goals\n\n    By Charlotte Greenfield and Sonali Paul\n    WELLINGTON/MELBOURNE, June 1 (Reuters) - New Zealand has set\nout to burnish its clean, green image by becoming Asia Pacific's\nfirst developed economy to stop using fossil fuels to generate\npower, although the pitfalls encountered by a Maori iwi, or\ntribe, may signal trouble ahead. \n    The 3,000-member Ngaati Kea Ngaati Tuara iwi in Rotorua,\nwhen switching to renewables, found local geothermal sources\nwere not hot enough to generate electricity. \n    So, the tribe set up small hydro units for its meeting\nground and dairy farm,  but the units struggle to operate during\nfloods and to produce enough power at peak demand, said project\nmanager Eugene Berryman-Kamp. A battery could store energy for\nperiods of high use, but there is currently \"no appetite\" to\ninvest the more than $10,000 needed, he said. \n    New Zealand, in its push to be free of power fired by coal\nand natural gas, would likely face similar problems scaled to\nnational size and potentially billions of dollars in costs. \n    \"If we move too quickly, the risk is to the New Zealand\nconsumer having to pay more for their energy and (this) could\nmake New Zealand less competitive as a market,\" said Marc\nEngland, chief executive of New Zealand's biggest energy\nretailer and fourth-biggest generator, Genesis Energy <GNE.NZ>. \n    Other countries that have turned fully to renewables for\npower - such as Norway and Denmark - are connected to regional\ngrids that can help back up shortages. New Zealand, in the\nremote South Pacific, would not have that option. \n    New Zealand would need large batteries, extra wind and solar\npower, and might still need to use gas or coal to prevent\nblackouts. Such investments would send costs soaring and could\nalienate voters who elected Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern last\nyear, in part due to her pledge to counter climate change. \n    Ardern said in April the government was also halting new\noffshore oil and gas exploration permits as part of efforts to\nconvert the nation to renewable energy by 2035. [nL3N1RO5US] \n    \n    HUGE INVESTMENTS, HIGHER PRICES \n    Critics say Ardern's goals would require huge investments in\nrenewable energy sources, grid expansion, and an overhaul of New\nZealand's biggest export industry, dairy, which relies heavily\non coal, driving up power prices. \n    Sapere Research Group advised Wellington its goals would\nrequire wholesale electricity prices to rise by up to 60 percent\nto around NZ$100 ($70) per megawatt-hour (MWh), making them some\nof the highest in the world. \n    That would destroy a key advantage for agriculture and\nindustry in New Zealand, where baseload power futures are\ncurrently running about 25 percent less than in Australian\nstates New South Wales and Victoria, where soaring electricity\ncosts have forced some manufacturers to shut. \n    A backlash from industry and politicians has deepened\npartisan fault lines that Ardern's centre-left government,\ninstalled in October, is trying so smooth over. But the\ncriticism has not stopped her from looking to establish a legacy\nby combating climate change. \n    Ardern's government has set a goal for the country to be\ncarbon neutral by 2050 - emitting no more carbon dioxide than\nits biosphere can absorb - an effort she compares to an earlier\ngeneration standing against nuclear warfare and declaring New\nZealand a \"nuclear free\" zone. \n    Climate Change Minister James Shaw has set up a panel to\ndevelop a carbon neutrality plan by mid-2019, and a public and\nbusiness consultation is scheduled for June. \n    \"We need to be looking at ... more renewable generation and\npotentially storage to replace our ageing fossil fuel\ngenerators, as well as energy efficiency initiatives to better\nmanage demand,\" Shaw told Reuters. \n   \n    NO MORE COAL FOR DAIRY COWS \n    New Zealand gets more than 80 percent of its energy from\nrenewables, mostly hydropower. Another 14 percent comes from\nnatural gas and 3 percent from coal. \n    Fonterra Co-operative Group <FCG.NZ>, however, the world's\ntop dairy exporter and one of New Zealand's biggest energy\nusers, gets around two-thirds of its energy from fossil fuels. \n    Fonterra is trying to ditch coal, but a change is going to\n\"require significant investment\", said Chief Operating Officer\nRobert Spurway. \n    \"It's very important to us that we find ways to do this in\nan economically sustainable way so that we remain competitive\nglobally,\" Spurway told Reuters. \n    Part of the problem is that while most of the population and\nindustry is on the North Island, most of the hydro stations are\non the South Island. That increases the outage risk because of\nthe possibility of damage to the cables connecting the two\nislands.\n    \"The inconvenient truth in New Zealand is for decades we've\nused coal to back up hydroelectricity,\" Genesis CEO England told\nReuters. \n    New Zealand's biggest power plant, Huntly, owned by Genesis,\nwas due to shut its coal units in 2018, but rival generator\nMeridian Energy <MEL.NZ> agreed to pay Genesis to keep them open\nas back-up at least until 2022. \n        \n    WANTED: MORE WATER \n    Genesis said batteries are not yet an economic option to\nfall back on through extended droughts. New Zealand lakes have\nonly up to eight weeks of water storage, while\nhydropower-dependent Norway has about two years' worth. \n    Many analysts still say New Zealand's plan to go green is\nviable and will benefit the country, although England said\nswitching to electric vehicles (EV) to wean transport off petrol\nwould be better than 100 percent renewable power generation. \n    \"(EV) could be a better economic choice for the market as a\nwhole,\" he said. \n    Berryman-Kamp said power independence has become a point of\npride for the Ngaati Kea Ngaati Tuara iwi, and that he gets\nrequests each month from other tribes interested in making\nsimilar changes. \n    \"They like the idea that we're self-sufficient ... They like\nthe idea that we're minimizing environmental impact.\" \n           \n    ($1 = 1.4474 New Zealand dollars) \n\n    <^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^\nGRAPHIC: New Zealand power prices are low    https://reut.rs/2rzuBcn\n    ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^>\n (Reporting by Charlotte Greenfield in WELLINGTON and Sonali\nPaul in MELBOURNE;
